Package edu.cornell.gdiac.json

Class LevelModel

java.lang.Object
edu.cornell.gdiac.json.LevelModel
public class LevelModel extends Object
Represents a single level in our game

Note that the constructor does very little. The true initialization happens by reading the JSON value. To reset a level, dispose it and reread the JSON.

The level contains its own Box2d World, as the World settings are defined by the JSON file. However, there is absolutely no controller code in this class, as the majority of the methods are getters and setters. The getters allow the GameController class to modify the level elements.

  • Constructor Details

    • LevelModel

      public LevelModel()
      Creates a new LevelModel

      The level is empty and there is no active physics world. You must read the JSON file to initialize the level

      public boolean getDebug()
      Returns whether this level is currently in debug node

      If the level is in debug mode, then the physics bodies will all be drawn as wireframes onscreen

      whether this level is currently in debug node

    • drawProjectileRay

      public void drawProjectileRay(com.badlogic.gdx.utils.JsonValue levelFormat, com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.g2d.TextureRegion asset, GameCanvas canvas)
      Draws the path of the projectile using a raycast. Only works for shooting in a straight line (gravity scale of 0).
      Parameters:
      levelFormat - The JSON value defining the level
      asset - The asset used to draw the trajectory. Must be round for good results.
      canvas - The GameCanvas to draw the trajectory on.

    • draw

      public void draw(GameCanvas canvas, com.badlogic.gdx.utils.JsonValue levelFormat, float gumSpeed, float gumGravity, com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.g2d.TextureRegion gumProjectile)
      Draws the level to the given game canvas

      If debug mode is true, it will outline all physics bodies as wireframes. Otherwise it will only draw the sprite representations.

      Parameters:
      canvas - the drawing context
